text: Geoff Capes (23 August 1949 â€“ 23 October 2024) was an English shotput champion, two times world's strongest man and a champion budgerigar breeder (now president of the British Budgerigar Breeding Association. He was born in 1949 in Holbeach, Lincolnshire. He is 6 foot 6 inches tall, which is unusually tall. He weighed 139 kg or 306 stone. He used to be a policeman but retired when he became a shotputter in the 1970s. His best throw was in 1980 and was 20.5 metres. This record stood until 2003, over twenty years. Capes once advertised caravans in South Yorkshire. Capes died on 23 October 2024 in Stoke Rochford, Lincolnshire at the age of 75. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2024 deaths Category:British athletes Category:Sportspeople from Lincolnshire
